data.title: Homebuilders got a bit of a break from Trump’s tariffs, but the housing market could still suffer
data.summary: Tariffs will likely lead to higher construction costs, wary consumers.

data.title: What to know this week
data.summary: Tariffs will be at the center of the market action in the week ahead as Trump's latest announcements have sent stocks reeling.

data.title: 'The real world is not SimCity'
data.summary: President Trump hopes his tariffs will bring production and manufacturing back to the United States. CSPC Eisenhower Fellow Dan Mahaffee explains how Americans will feel the impact of tariffs because factories and supply chains cannot be rebuilt overnight. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

data.title: Starmer warns ‘world as we knew it has gone’ as countries mull tariff responses - live updates
data.summary: PM says he will use policy to shelter British businesses following the stock market turmoil prompted by Trump’s announcement

data.title: Carney says Canada will win trade war with U.S.
data.summary: Liberal Leader Mark Carney worked to ease anxiety among pensioners and other Canadians worried about their savings evaporating with market turmoil, declaring that Canada “will win” the trade war initiated by U.S. President Donald Trump

data.title: Trump pushes protectionist agenda amid GOP unease and market turmoil
data.summary: The tariff announcement was the latest and perhaps boldest manifestation of Trump's second-term freedom to lead with his instincts after feeling his first turn in the Oval Office was restrained by aides who did not share his worldview

data.title: Agriculture department confirms US beef not banned in Australia
data.summary: Cattle Australia says Donald Trump fails to recognise that the US has had access to the Australian market since 2019, provided it can demonstrate its beef comes from cattle born, raised and slaughtered in the US.
